title: Ticket #7407: Support session tokens for presigned S3 URLs
description: BrianB has a user willing to manage her own session token, so it shouldn't be hard to add support for passing it through to the crypto layer.
remarks:
2019-Dec-03 17:36:51 by tlmiller:
Use +EC2SessionToken to set the name of the file containing the session token, like the access and secret keys. The value must be quoted. 

universe = vanilla
executable = /bin/sleep
transfer_executable = false
arguments = 1

# aws_region = us-east-1
aws_access_key_id_file = TestRole.access
aws_secret_access_key_file = TestRole.secret
+EC2SessionToken = "TestRole.session"

should_transfer_files = always

transfer_input_files = s3://bucket/key
transfer_output_files = key

queue

2019-Dec-03 17:38:08 by tlmiller:
Should this have a submit command? It seems like such a partial solution.

2019-Dec-04 10:40:27 by bbockelm:
@tlmiller:

  • Were you able to test this at all? Or should we pull in the user to help testing?
  • Given we want to hand this off to a user, can we also add the first-class alias for the submit file language (e.g., aws_session_token)

2019-Dec-04 13:21:17 by tlmiller:
  • I did basic functionality testing (aws sts assume-role...), and it does work, but we should certainly ask the user to verify that it works for her and her use case before we get too excited about it.
  • My plan is to create a ticket to add the submit command tied for v8.9.6, and revisit the issue after we've gotten some validation and feedback. I'll think about it some more; maybe calling it aws_session_token_file isn't so bad, because it does rather imply that you have to obtain one for yourself. (Do we want to automatically include, or have as an option, a credentials-timeout?)

2019-Dec-04 13:26:54 by bbockelm:
> I did basic functionality testing (aws sts assume-role...),

Great! We were certainly going to have the user look at it ASAP, but I feel more confident if she's the second, not the first...

> I'll think about it some more; maybe calling it aws_session_token_file isn't so bad

I think it's perfectly fine. Given that there are no ways to automate this for the user (it's all custom NIH code), exposing just the fundamental piece is OK with me.

2019-Dec-04 13:28:07 by tlmiller:
I'd like to delay (further) documentation until 8.9.6 (see #7410) or at least until the user has verified that this works for them.
